review: My perception of California Pizza Kitchen has always been of a gourmet pizzeria that serves tiny pizzas at twice the price. However, having visited CPK for the first time this past weekend, I admit that my assumptions were totally off base. We came here to celebrate our friend's engagement and the CPK staff was very accommodating to our large party and reservation time change. They even moved a few tables around so we could all sit together. One pizza was enough to fill me up and at roughly $12 per pizza, it was very reasonable. I ordered the Garlic Chicken Pizza and it was heavy on the garlic, just the way I like it. We also ordered the Tortilla Soup which was good but a little thicker than we're used to. The complementary baskets of sourdough bread and butter were amazing. I normally don't rave about free bread but it was delicious.  Drinks are on the more expensive side ($3 for an Italian Soda) but it was bottomless, so make sure you get plenty of refills and pee before you come. My tummy gives California Pizza Kitchen...4 stars!

I am sure this will hurt my culinary reputation, but I think this CPK is worth at least 3.5 stars.  Their pizzas and pastas are filling and pretty inexpensive, with ingredients a little nicer and more innovative than the typical chain restaurant.  They have fun stuff like the BLT Pizza which has lettuce on the top.   They have decent cocktails and beers--boring and not great priced wine list. I don't love the croutons or dressing in their caesar salad and no it is not Cotogna, but it also is in a mall and doesn't cost that much.  Seems like a good place for a kid's birthday dinner.

I took me a long time to find something I liked on the menu. I wasted a good amount of money ordering things that just weren't good, but I found my favorites (after 8 visits) and now I love the place! The caramel apple crumble dessert is awesome, Sicilian pizza is always good, and the Thai crunch salad is one of me favorites. Some of the small plates are pretty good too. I like the quesadilla and the tacos the best. The Mediterranean plate was too small for even a small plate and the taste of it was off. Tasted like I was licking a roll of film or chewing on the soles of a new pair of sneakers. Even though I focused on the negative in this review, that's is all the bad I have to say. Overall CPK is a good value and a good meal. I will be back. Soon.

The service we received can be labeled friendly though slightly mechanical. Our server was courteous in his interaction with us but there were no follow ups, no suggestions on drinks, entrees or dessert. The quality check on the entrees was never done.  We were even less impressed with the food so, when asked about our experience we responded with a slight hint that we were OK but not more than that. Our server took this however as a positive response and took off with a "so you are good?!"  as he took off in the distance. The manager on duty visited our table on her round and asked about our experience so far. We explained that we were not impressed with the food. It was however surprising that our complaints about the pasta being undercooked, the chicken of our dish being overcooked and the toppings on our pizza being dried out were met with excuses on how it was to be expected with a thin crust pizza and that the al dente way of cooking pasta was just a matter of taste. She apologized about the fact that we did not enjoy our meal but it did not come across to us as if she cared too much about it since no efforts were made to correct the issue. She greeted us with a smile and we did not see her after that.   I was not out for a free meal but I would expect some effort made to keep me happy as a customer. All in all our experience was pretty bad which is sad because we take out food quite often from CPK and are usually happy with the quality offered. I will however go back to see whether this was a once in an incident as I am a strong believer of second changes

It is a rare day that I am not craving their Original BBQ Chicken Pizza or Thai Chicken Salad. As a weight watchers member I am surprised and greatful how many things on the CPK Menu are WW friendly. The staff are always attentive and the tables are always clean. It is a great place to take your kids here.
I have been to this location several times, but last week was my last! The food was undercooked, the re-delivered, burnt! No apologies, zip. Service particuylarly by Rennie, NOT GOOD.
The manner in which they handled an off night will keep us coming back.

CPK Corte Madera graciously welcomed us and 60+ other people for cocktails and snacks the night before our wedding. Our group was staying down the street at the Corte Madera Inn. We realized that this isn't something that they usually do so we were very appreciative. It was a wonderful way to get together with some of our out-of-town guests. The staff was gracious and helpful. Good times!

This CPK is an average dining experience.  Like all chain restaurants, you can tell their food isn't made with the highest quality ingredients.  The people who work there are great, my service was immaculate, but I can't get over how cheap the food tastes.

Server friendly and smiley, but delivered poor almost non existent service. She could not tell me what beer was on tap, so I ordered one blindly to avoid their bud type selection and was disappointed.  The next disappointment was the pizza. I had theirs before years ago, and maybe I'm getting forgetful. My BBQ chicken pizza was just ok. The BBQ sauce was slightly better than ketchup, and there was supposed to be red onions on it. I saw maybe one slice. Now lets bash my wife's pizza. I tried to warn her, but she ordered the Thai chicken pizza. I love Thai food, but this bastardization was terrible. It was simply pizza dough, skippy peanut butter, chicken and topped with dried shredded carrots and bean sprouts. WTF $50 for that dissapointing crappy lunch.
Great Pizza, Pasta & Key Lime Pie.  Service was excellent.

Food not bad. Atmosphere rather like a pizza hut. Service?  Well we received something we did not order, but it's our fault because orderer had a child menu in front of them. Huh?  Oh and thing we ordered was not on child menu.  O-ok! Customer is always right except when you make a mistake, then the customer made you bring them something you did not want. I don't blame the server, who was nice, i blame the manager who came out and they were confused because orderer had child menu in front of them.  Huh?  Really?  What you have brought if he had a victoria secret catalog in front of him.

Chicken Tequila Pasta ! is by far a simple but fulling and great plate if you're in the area.Service is fast and always attending.(my daughter has fun while we wait for our food with some bread and coloring paper)

Today, my boyfriend and I were delivered a pear and gorgonzola pizza that had four pieces of fishing line baked into the cheese! Yes, FISHING LINE! Each piece was about 4 inches long. We called the manager, told him what happened, and he said they'd deliver a new one. We got the replacement pizza and immediately picked up a slice to check, sure enough ANOTHER fishing line was sticking out of it! We showed it to the delivery guy and he confirmed it was fishing line. I'm quite disgusted and fairly disappointed that the manager didn't check for plastic before sending out our second pizza. One complaint should be enough to have it looked into.  Can't say I'll ever be ordering from this CPK again.

I used to eat here all the time and the food was pretty good but I stopped going here because in turned into a zoo. It's like being in a daycare. I don't mind kids at all but this place has let children get completely out of control. Normal I would say parents are the problem but at some point a business needs to step in and say no to people who let their children run a muck in a restaurant. I tried to stick it out but after having a child literally sneeze in my food I said that's enough. I will never go back. Sorry CPK but grow up. Who knew asking a parent to ask their children to sit down and stop screaming was so hard .

It's pizza...and its a chain...the waiters could be better with not rushing you, but it is not fine dinning.  The food does the job though.  Love the garlic chicken thin crust and the watermelon strawberry salad (ask for dressing on the side because the drench it)...

I love this place! I grew up in LA where this was popular, i would go with my sister every so often. The food is delicious, and all so that's why I give it 3 stars.      I was however disappointed with the waiter service, they brought my pizza ok but my mom and sister got salads that weren't what they ordered. They took a long time to correct the problem too. It turns out those salads were for the table next to us. Also my sister ordered a Cobb salad & asked not to put chicken in. Since they had to do it over they didn't omit the chicken. Usually the waiters are different each time so don't worry we're gonna be back. The pizza is too good not to!
How can a pizza place screw up a cheese pizza?  Worst pizza i ever had in my life.  And the slowest service; waited 27 minutes for a f..ing cheese pizza.

I must say, was really surprised.  Why should I be surprised?   Well, I think restaurant chain food is typically OK but not exceptional.  But in this case the quality of the food WAS exceptional.   Started with several kinds of flatbreads.  All were really good and the crusts were just so light and crispy.  The dishes were really flavorful and each bite filled my mouth with joy.   Also tried a small salad with a chunk of salmon on top.  Very good.  Tried a few pizzas including a pepperoni, BBQ chicken, garlic chicken, and plain cheese.   All were really good.  Again, very flavorful.   For dessert I recommend the tiramisu.  Its creamy yet light.   Bottom line for me is that this place may be part of a big chain but the food is like that of a high quality independent restaurant.

Many moons ago, at her suggestion, I joined a friend for lunch at Walnut Creek's California Pizza Kitchen.  It wasn't a place I'd have selected on my own as I generally don't choose pizza and never for lunch.  I was happily surprised however, to find that CPK's menu had a number of entree-sized salads.  I ordered some sort of entree-sized chopped salad and I remember it as being quite good.  I also remember the restaurant having an upscale, grown-up feeling that appealed to me.  For ambience with adult appeal it compared more closely to Cheesecake Factory than, say, Chili's, and that's a good thing.  It proved a good choice in both food and ambience and a great place for lunch with a close  friend. Despite my mom often suggesting CPK as a Southern Cali dining option I'd not returned to a CPK until recently, when Yelp hosted an event at this Corte Madera location.  First off, props to the CPK staff at this event.  All of them, from the owner to the manager to the servers were 5-star perfection.  They greeted us with warm welcomes, were enthusiastic about what they had to offer, and engaged with diners and drinkers in a way that seemed genuine.  They seemed excited about what they were sharing and you know what?  They had a reason to be.   I didn't sample every single thing that came by but I did try a few things I'd recommend and return for:    *  Bianco Flatbread is a new offering and was my most favorite item sampled.  A cracker-crust-like dough is topped with whipped truffle cream, Gorgonzola, Mozzarella, and fresh sage.  Fresh out of the pizza oven this thing was fantastic.  If I returned with a friend I'd order it straight-away, as something for our table to share, never mind that I don't often eat pizza.   *  A salad topped with Salmon was very tasty and protein packed but even tastier, to my tongue, was one made of quinoa and spinach.  It'd be difficult to ignore menu offerings such as the Cobb Salad but if I started with the Bianco Flatbread I'd probably have to.  I vote the Spinach/Quinoa Salad as the perfect accompaniment.   *  I chuckled when the server introduced me to "the classic" BBQ Chicken Pizza.  I guess he meant classic CPK as I don't recall having seen BBQ Chicken Pizza on the menu anywhere else.  And, as ridiculous as that combo sounds, there's a reason it's a CPK-classic.  Hot and bubbly and fresh from the oven it's a great mix of good tastes.   CPK Corte Madera has recently opened a little outdoor patio complete with gas fireplace and amply heat-producing lamps.  It adds to the adult appeal of the place and is a very nice addition even if it has no views (they're in a mall).   This visit to CPK has caused me to wonder why I've not previously returned.  Now that I've had a look-see at their menu updates, a chance to widely sample their offerings, and the opportunity to meet the wonderful people in charge of this place I can honestly say that I'd be happy to return.  In fact, I'll take my mom up on it next time she makes a suggestion.  Despite the fact that our palates are worlds apart, CPK's menu offers food and ambience we both can enjoy.  As I left, I noticed that CPK is currently offering a $20 bonus if you purchase $100 worth of gift cards (deal also available on the web site).  I'm considering it; CPK definitely won me over.  Good job.

California Melted Cheeeeeeeeese! SITREP Oh hell to the YUM!  There are many tasty experiences to be enjoyed here at the California Pizza Kitchen (CPK).  Set-up in the Corte Madera Town Center, this is a great location to try some new cuisines. THE SETUP As one of their leading flagship-locations, CPK created an "exclusive tasting" of their new flatbread menu, and it was a delicious & hearty experience. And this stop was a breath of fresh-air - often it's all too easy to denigrate an establishment just because it is part of a chain.  But quality is quality, and a delicious dinner is all you could hope for no matter who prepares it for you. THE DELICIOUS FOOD I have to give a huge thanks to CPK for "rolling out the dough" for our group of friends with a generous selection of pizzas.  These included: *  Bianco Flatbread, a very delicate combination of whipped truffle cream, gorgonzola and mozzarella cheeses, and my favorite pizza herb sage! *  Shaved Mushroom with Spinach, which consisted of Cremini mushrooms, spinach, and infused olive oil with Romano and Parmesan cheese in it.  YUM. *  Spicy Fennel Sausage with Poblano was also delicious and you could taste the mozzarella, fire-roasted chilies, sausage and oregano with a spicy marinara sauce. *  My actual favorite slices however were the gluten-free Pepperonis, the crust consisting of a potato-based dough.  Oh YUM!  I was quite surprised at the delicious-chewy consistency of this slice which made it extremely yummy for me.  I think I somehow managed to finagle 3 slices of this baby! GREAT STAFF CPK Manager Christina came over and spent time with us, sharing the vision fof what CPK offers to the local community.  We were also warmly served by diligent CPK staff members Jose and Rosanna whom saw to our wine & dining needs during our meal, letting us experience different kinds of flatbreads, salads and pizzas.  P-A-T-I-O! They have engaged in some new renovations, and one of the most notable additions is the new patio, with large tables, elegant fire columns and a fire pit.  This is indeed a great location to have a table of fires, or even host an entire group of people for a great little shindig! THE LOWDOWN   For a great dinner experience in Marin County, I truly recommend a stop at CPK for a fantastic nigh of their new winter food & wine offerings.

I was pleasantly surprised at my experience at CPK. I always associate this restaurant with their frozen pizzas available at your local grocery store, however eating there in person is a much better experience than cooking their pizza at home! For starters, their cocktail (i got a paloma) was delicious. I had had a relatively rough day at work, and this cocktail prepared by the gentleman behind the bar was strong, tasty and immediately improved my spirits. My girlfriend and i tried an appetizer platter that was prepared wonderfully. We had so many different types of pizza and flat bread samples that I was stuffed by the end of the night. It looks like they have renovated their outdoor areas as well. There are now full coverings, and fire pits outside for both cold and warm nights alike. I like what they are doing with the place, and look forward to their grand "re-opening" when their renovations are complete! Service, food and beverage, 4.5 stars +!

came here around 8 20 pm... I ordered a veggie pizza and my buddy got a Cedar salmon and a lemonade... My pizza was pretty good so was the salmon. Service was pretty bad even though it was only 2 tables there. I guess our waitress just wanted to call it a night ????!!!!!!!!!!! She didn't want to refill my glass of water or ask if we need anything ... She just stood at the corner and kept on gossip with people from the kitchen... next time I'll order take out, there was no service so if I order take out I won't have to pay any tip and serve myself at home !

I can still remember the day this place opened! It was so exciting for marin. Anyways, for some reason or another I have not been back in ages. It's like I forget it's here. Anyways, fun pasta dishes, the traditional pizzas, creative desserts and some other good options. There is a sees right next door, so you can't complain about that. Plus I LOVE chocolate! Did I forget to say that??? Well, service was still excellent. Thank you for your friendly faces and a cozy family friendly spot! Ohhhh and they have wine too. Mmmmmm

What an absolute shame. This place use to have my favorite pizza of all time - the classic bbq chicken pizza. There "better" changes are absolutely horrible. The new tossed crust tastes bland and has the consistency of a stale cracker. The toppings also lack luster. For a pizza that was soo great with flavors and that had a nice airy crust has now become bland.

We eat here at least twice a month.  The salads are great.  Pear pizza is another favoritate.  Our orders are always spot on perfect (even special requests).  The food quality is reliably good.  The menu changes and they try new things, so we don't get bored.   We regularly get EXCELLENT service from a wide range of servers (it's busy on weekend nights so service won't be as attentive or quick).  It's like the manager(s) hire wait staff who really want to make people happy. We keep coming to Cauliflower Peaches Kissin' (that's what we call it) in Corte Madera for three reasons:  great food, good value, and service that's always pleasant and efficient.

One star because I have to choose one.  CA Pizza Kitchen is a chain. So food is pretty much the same everywhere. Kinda pricy in my opinion but it is what it is. My complaints are regarding service. TERRIBLE  Our server Zack was fine. Seemed a little flustered but nice guy overall.  If you go as a large party caution!!!They don't split checks, And they can use three cards MAX for the check. So either bring cash or someone's putting the bill on their card. After discussing it with the manager it turns out they actually can. Guess they just prefer not too.    Took manager over a half hour to cash us out. And when she finally got everyone the checks, she mixed too orders up. That's understandable I guess, mistakes happen. But what is not understandable is her telling those two people if they can work it out among themselves.  Yes! SHE BASICALLY ASKED THOSE TWO TO WORK IT OUT INSTEAD OF HER FIXING HER MISTAKE.  Unacceptable.  One star.  Won't be going back  Their is a really cool Vietnamese restaurant in the area. Go their :)
It is a great place to take kids and the food is actually good and very reasonable.  I had a salad , which was better than good.  Our server was on the ball and very pleasant.

Have been coming here for years and lately just for lunch take out. Just had to point out that lately had some really rude experiences when picking up my lunch. Female worker refuses to acknowledge people at Take Out counter, instead yelling at some other guy to do it. Then being rude to the guy in front of me. This has happened the last 3 times I have been here. It is never appropriate to be condescending and rude to another employee in front of customers, period.

Did the Corte Madera location change ownership recently? While food quality and service has been on the decline for the past year or so, our experience there on Sunday was exceptionally poor. The Thai Chicken Pizza was bland and tasteless. The same could be said of the Cobb Salad. The service was sloppy and awkward throughout. At one point the manager---at least we thoughthe was the manager---appeared at our table, eyeballed my mojito and mumbled something about the spearmint  garnish. As soon as he appeared he disappeared. Really odd. We've been customers of CPK in Corte Madera for years and it's been better. Will definitely give it a second thought next time we're in town.

My friend and I ordered CURBSIDE PICKUP. I arrived at the time they said it would be ready, waited about 10 minutes and then went in. They lead me to the take out area so obviously curbside isn't a thing there. The young waitress at the bar gave me my iced tea with it overflowing, which is not the best but I could handle it. I put the drinks in the bag soon to realize that the iced tea cup was broken and it leaked everywhere. So I had to drive home with iced tea slowly dripping all over my car, one of which is my baby and I just got it washed so you can only imagine my frustration. To top it all off bringing the food in was a struggle considering the bag had no bottom.  But yes, the food was still pretty good. So if you're craving CPK- EAT THERE

As for the food I would rate CPK a 5. The service this time was overwhelmingly subpar. Our server was an older lady by the name of Beth who wouldn't smile if David Beckham fell from the sky naked and asked her to marry him. Her attitude was very very sour. My boyfriend and I asked if we could split a pizza half and half because we weren't very hungry and she insisted that we get two separate pizzas (higher bill=higher tip)... I work in the restaurant business as well. She had a very harsh tone and was very snippy and our whole party noticed and quickly exchanged confused glances. I will refuse to eat here again if placed in her section. Unfortunately my tips are based on the service, not the price of my bill. I have given 100% tips on $5 coffee bills. Hers will not be as generous. Send her back to training please or ask if she needs a hug.

Let's be clear here...we know this is basically glorified fast food.  I mean,you can buy this pizza frozen at the supermarket.  A lot of the ingredients are most likely not the best quality.  On this evening we were trying to find a spot to eat where it was cooler...HOT in my town! I had not eaten at this place in about 5 years.  The service is pretty bad...I basically had to ask for most things;water,can we order,the check!?! The pizza was ok and the Asian salad was kinda weird...way too many soy beans(I kept tasting this in my mouth for hours after). Most likely will not return.

CPK just refused to complete our pizza order when we showed up to pick up at 9:00 pm.  Serious letdown.  We eat here often.  I doubt we will show up again.  Seriously, make your own pizzas!  You can make your own at home better than this.  CPK is totally cheap with the toppings.  You can count the pieces on one hand sometimes.  I started making my own at home and everyone loves them.

This is the Sicilian pizza on a very thin crispy crust.  This pizza is delicious.  Ive tried a couple of others here and this one is the best. As for the service, IT SUCKS.  Ive been there 3 time over the past 3 months after long trail runs and the service has been terrible all 3 times. This place is never busy but the servers ive had work so slow.  Next time I'm trying this other place in the shopping center called Blue Barn.

I come here for takeout. they have a nice curb side pick up system. when I call, they already know my name and the make and color of my car based on my phone number (from previous orders). when my order is ready, I drive to the curb in front of the restaurant and a waiter comes out to deliver my food and take payment thru my window. I don't have to get out of my car. almost like a McDonald's drive thru. ironically I'm not a huge fan of their pizza.  when I do get the pizza, the mushroom one is my fave. but my regular order is the kung pao spaghetti.  pretty awesome creation.

First off, let me start by saying I've been here about 10 times before.  I don't particularly care for the food- typical bland chain restaurant food.  However, kids love it, so every now and then I'll cave and sacrifice my taste buds for them. After my experience here last night, I doubt I'll be back.  I was meeting some friends who were in town for a dinner with their family.  I showed up a few minutes early because there were 9 of us and I thought it might take a bit to get a table set up.  The hostess was actually pretty quick in setting up the table, and I was seated just before 6:25- my friends were supposed to meet me at 6:30.   My friends got stuck in traffic, so I sat at the table with my 2 kids for about 10 minutes without ever seeing a server.  Finally, at about 6:35, a waiter approached and said "I know you are waiting on the rest of your party, but can I get you something to drink?"  I was grateful, so I ordered a water for myself and two drinks for the kids.  He said he'd be right back. The rest of my party arrived at about 6:43 (I am only particular about times because I had my phone out and was texting them as this was all going on).  I still hadn't gotten my water or the kids drinks.  We checked out the menu and were all ready to order in a matter of minutes, but still saw no waiter.  I looked around the room for him, and when I finally saw him, tried to flag him to get his attention but it's like he looked right through me.   So, as time goes on and the kids we have with us start to get restless, with whinings of "I'm thirsty".  I glance at my phone.  6:55.  Still no water.  For crying out loud, I've been sitting here 30 minutes and can't even get a glass of water?  My friends are officially as annoyed as we are, and we start to talk about other foods, and other local restaurants this NEVER would happen at.  7:00, still no one. Finally, all the adults look at each other at the same time and say, "This is ridiculous".  I try one more time to try to get our waiters attention- nothing.  We all start to get up out of frustration.  It's pretty obvious we're all leaving, and at THAT MOMENT the waiter rushes up to me and says "I'm getting your drinks."  Um, 25 minutes later you are getting my water?  I just looked him in the eye and said "Look, we got no service, we're going somewhere that wants our business."  And we all headed for the door.   The hostess looked at us confused, and I told her flat out "We were ignored for over a half hour, had no service, so we're leaving."   We then went to a locally run restaurant where we were welcomed in, immediately served and had a fantastic meal.  CPK really needs to get their service act together....absolutely unbelievable.

This was for a order to go , Restaurant is a little dark but looked clean.  Pizza was soggy and toppings really didn't have that much of a taste. Service was fast and friendly though but I probably would not order from here again based on the food quality and price.

I came here with some friends and was given some of the most horrible service I've ever had at a CPK. And I usually LOVE CPK.  First off, after seating it took a solid 10 minutes to even get waters or drink orders.  After we finally were asked our drink order, I was asked for ID as I ordered a margarita. I then showed my ID. And the server says thank you and left. Another ten minuets go by so I asked for my drink again.  The server then tells me I'm not 21, that I turn 21 in October, and he won't serve me.... But I am 21! I showed my ID AGAIN and he then attempted to get my drink again.  Another ten minutes later, I ask again, still no drink.  Finally my drink and the rest of my tables' drinks finally come.  Embarrassed, we order food. It takes a solid 30 minutes to make the 3 small pizzas we ordered and the restaurant was not busy in the slightest.   The pizzas were also subpar.  I ordered my favorite pear asiago cheese. The pears were not well caramelized and the bottom of the pizza was surprisingly greasy.  In addition, we were never asked how we were doing or for drink refills.  I was blown away at the lack of service and communication from servers....

I've been to many different CPKs before, but this was my first -- and last -- time at the Corte Madera location. The service was just atrocious. I hate complaing about service on yelp and understand waiters have bad days, but the experience was so poor we might as well have gone to a Mcdonalds. Our waiter George really didn't seem to care at all about being a waiter. In fact I had to flag him down twice before we got refills on our water and iced tea. If the restaurant was super busy I'd understand but it wasn't - he just seemed to be wandering around in a daze. He not once checked up on our table and asked how our food was or if we wanted more drinks or anything. That alone was bothersome but what really got me was how our waiter responded to being told that the pasta in my friend's dish wasn't cooked (it really wasn't cooked, there was a whole chunk of pasta that was still rock solid.) Usually when you tell a waiter something like that either they 1) offer to replace this at no charge and/or 2) offer to talk to the manager and not charge you for the dish, or at least offer something like a free dessert. But our waiter just said, almost sarcastically, "I'll have to tell the kitchen about that." I could tell he wasn't planning on telling the kitchen anything. Maybe all CPK service has gone down since I used to go to them a while ago, but I haven't had this bad service anywhere in a long time.

I had just brought my parents to the cruise ship depot in San Francisco after a morning of little nourishment when I came across the Corte Madera Town Center, royally craving a hamburger. There was a place I was aware of that I thought would cater to my liking, but it being around 1PM on an early fall Saturday, the play was batsh.. insane with little kids running about, with the ostensible parents not acting much better. So, choice #2: California Pizza Kitchen. I had eaten there once before, about three years ago and found the experience adequate if not particularly memorable. So I went in, where I was instantly seated at the bar and served a soda. I ordered a Hawaiian Barbeque Chicken pizza pie, which took about 20 minutes to cook and deliver. In the meantime I was able to read a Hockey preview magazine without being bothered (although my soda was refilled without my having to ask). The pizza was filling without delivering me into a food coma. My only complaint was that the crust did leave that 'cling to the roof of my mouth' aftertaste. I followed it up with a brownie pudding, which was quite good. Didn't have to eat again until late that night. No, it's not something you'd find in Italy, or New York or even Chicago. So what, it is still pizza, it does what it is supposed to do. Will return.

Don't know about this location. Maybe it was the time, or the staff.  We were greeted by a busboy who obviously doesn't have honed customer service skills but to his credit, he did apologize and told us the host was not available.  He sat us and provided everything we needed.  Soon we were greeted by the waitress - nice, young gal.  Took 32 minutes to get our food.  Then there was something going on with the table behind us which involved some apologies from the manager.  Then we had a waiter change. Nothing wrong with that - actually, our new waiter was VERY attentive and took care of some things the previous waitress should had.  Overall, nothing wrong with the food. It's always good. Good, not excellent, but good. You want excellent pizza, you go east. New York or Chicago.  Management - pay attention to your staff and the facilities. I used the restroom upon arrival and the trash can was overflowing. Used it again before departure and there was trash on the floor because it had not been emptied.

CPK is chain restaurant. Food is rather consistent at any one of them. As for atmosphere, I found it can vary dramatically. I'm from Hawaii, and the one I went to as a kid made CPK somewhat of a swanky place to be. Not like this one here in Corte Madera. I went here one night with my boyfriend for a casual bite to eat. Not expecting much, but the service was SO incredibly slow, like ridiculously slow.... That is my main complaint. That, and they can't make a single cocktail, not even the ones listed in their menu. Not a place for good drinks or quick service. I'll stick to the one in Ala Moana, where the place is packed, the waiters and bartenders are cute and charming, trying hard to earn those tips. That I can appreciate.

Let me start off by saying that I LOVE eating at CPK but this location was straight up awful! We got there on a Sunday night, busy as it should be on a Sunday, we were seated (party of 7) in less then 5 minutes. So far so good! Once we got seated, we looked over our menus and the service still had not greeted us at our table.  When he finally showed up, he started speaking to us in Spanish (which we understood, but why assume?) and told is that he was new there and it was his 4th night. Holy cow never had a server tell me that before. We ordered a bottle of wine and appetizers & ask that the kids meal come out with the appetizers. The waiter asked us about twice what we wanted to order (he wasn't familiar with the menu at all or drink menu for that matter).  Once we ordered all that, we waited and waited and waited until the hostess came to us and asked if we wanted break while we waited and that she would go get our waiter. We got our bread and this about an hour or so after we sat down. About 30 minutes later we started to get our food - plate by plate - some plates missing items, some warm and some plates never came. We cancels several dishes and we orders two more pizzas.  To make the long story short, the waiter needed more training, the food was perfect (except for missing items and semi cold temps) , the drinks were good and the waiter tried none the less. It would have been a better experience if the waiter had more training. Would I come back here? If I was in the area but since this is out of my way, I would go to Walnut Creek or Emeryville location - much better service every single time!

Thank you CPK Customer Service. Some people in corporate saw my review and contacted me a few times--which I really appreciate. Thanks to their help, I was able to recoup the $15 overcharge to my satisfaction and was treated very well by customer service--and that great level of service and care earned you another star above my previous one-star post. So now I'm just waiting for the food and restaurant service to return to their former glory (so I can use the dining gift cards you sent me). Thanks again for taking care of me.
The manager gave me the sauce for free when I went back and apologized. So That's a plus.

Surprisingly good pizza for a chain. I tried wild mushroom on thin crust and it was delicious. Friendly service. Can get crowded so we prefer take out. I had to talk myself out of getting one more the next day.

I went to CPK yesterday and it was bustling. Still, me and my mother found seats outside. A few times a disgusting smell floated up and me and my mother couldn't find the source. Service was really slow, and music was sort of cliche.
Excellent food, We love ravioli, pizza and dessert was awesome!, (butter cake ), the services is great!, nice place,  good parking, nice people, highly recommend, A+

I don't know anybody can possibly eat this food the pizza tastes like cardboard very bland food  The waiter was too much in s hurry to take my food away and still eating. This place blows  The salad is fine
Have been here many times, and really enjoy it.  Service has always been quite good, very family friendly, and the food is always hot and delicious.  Highly recommended.
What a great experience.  I had a fabulous waitress.  Such a kind person . Camilla provides great service and that extra touch of interest in her customer.  The food was wonderful.
Take out took over 20 minutes. Would never order from there again. Really rude and team is not trained. Terrible service.

I'm a fan for the right reasons - the kids. If sans kids, it wouldn't be on my list. Everyone knows CPK and what it's all about. For me, the only reason to go here is so the crazy kids and act crazy and you won't feel uncomfortable that you kids are acting crazy. Crazy kids fit right in. Don't go here if you're an adult looking for a date place - it would be your last date.
Poor poor CPK.  You changed your pizza recipes, and changed my mind about ever coming here again.

New year off to a horrendous start. Came in when there were only 6 tables filled, so fairly empty. We were a group of 5 but did not expect a 40 min wait for a single refill of bread and water. Ended up leaving and eating at Starbucks instead.

This used to be a great go-to place when we were down in Corte Madera doing shopping. We knew it would be good, consistent and relatively fast with something on the menu for everyone. The only thing that has remained is the menu still has something for everyone but on every other level it disappoints. We went there during lunch time on a Saturday and it was I'd say about 3/4 full. They sat us off to the side in a seat near the window but we quickly realized that this area served as a sort of informal "employee gathering area." Employees were sitting all around us talking on their phones, talking to each other, eating their lunches, even counting out their money drawers (that constant "plonk! plonk!" of money falling into the drawer made for a nice atmosphere- let me tell you!)  We were sitting for 15 minutes before anyone came to acknowledge us or take our drink order. Orders were then messed up and the server argued saying that we said something else. Overall, the waiter was slow, surly and just had a bad attitude- no idea why. The food is just ok and, frankly, the only reason this place gets two instead of one star. The Thai chicken salad was flavorful but there was very little actual chicken involved- mostly lettuce and those little crunchy things. The pizzas my husband and son ordered were not very flavorful- needed salt or something- just pretty bland. For three people, and a basic order, the bill came to $50 before tip (and, yes, I did still tip although it was a tough argument to make.) Too much money to spend for an experience like this. You'll likely spend the same amount at the fish place around the corner and their food is WAY better!

Food was good the service was okay.  The food was good but nothing special. Ordered the veggie dip, ravioli, tostada pizza.  The food was all good but not good enough for four stars. The service was good also but not 4 stars worth.  Will try different dishes whenever my next visit here.

Very tasty food. Bit too expensive than other pizza places around. But taste makes it compromising. Very friendly staff. Nice place for large group of people. And you get lots of rewards and coupons once you sign up for their card. Great job Give it a try n you will not be disappointed.
The service has been really slow for several years. Take 30 mins to get a drink and another thirty to get the food.
I go for the Chinese Chicken salad delish each time. Staff is OK.

Cpk our go to quick sit down dinner something for everyone my wife gets a salad my daughter Mac and cheese plus a root beer, I have my choice of pasta or fish tacos. The kids menus changes just often enough so we are not board by the puzzles, word searches etc, PLUS the have Chimay blue, my favorite beer!

I'm not sure why people in bay area don't like chain restaurants, but there is something very comfortable about restaurant like CPK. It's consistent, kid friendly, and good service. They opened the door as soon as I was at the door with stroller.  Pizza is my husband's favorite food. I'm ok with it. But at CPK, there is Thai chicken pizza for Asian folks like me. No, it's not authentic but still good.
Hands down best experience at cpk. Great servers and fast ticket times and the pizza was excellent. My bro tried their new ribeye steak and was very impressed

I dislike the platitude, "It is what it is," but I must apply it here. There is food, and though not bad, it is not outstanding either. The vibe is neither off-putting, nor welcoming. Maybe it is the chain vibe? Or the parking lot entrance? Nonetheless, for dinner with kids, or the fly-in relative, the CPK will do. A few of the small plates are interesting.

Pretty meh overall Our waitress was pleasant but a total space cadet. Asked three times if we wanted bread, and then brought it about ten minutes after our meal.  Ordered a BBQ chicken pizza and attempted to order a cheese pineapple and olive pizza (basically a Hawaiian minus meat plus olive). Waitress just could not understand the concept of vegetarianism.  Pizza was bland. Bill ended up 40$ for 2 pizzas and 2 sodas... Expensive for the quality and taste.  Always annoyed to get charged for every little substitution. You better believe they charged for the olive they put on instead of the ham.  Stick to a real pizzeria. CPK is about as quality as their grocery frozen line of pizzas.
Food is very good. I like sitting at the bar. Love their salad and pizza. Service should be faster and waiter/waitress should pay more attention to customers.

I can't believe this place is so successful... Honestly, the food had such poor ingredients and the "famous spinach dip" was watered down and tasteless with the worst stale chips I've ever had. Who has chips with spinach dip? Isn't their suppose to be sourdough or some sort of bread? I only was here because it was selected by a friend before a movie. I will never let myself be brought down here again. RUN AWAY FROM THIS RESTAURANT!

Was a dedicated fan for years. Returned couple mos, ago- very accommodating waiter - great service- the salad was a mushy - he exchanged it for very good Tortilla soup. Returned today - spacey waitress - warm soup finally delivered. Would have returned it -had I not been with a client. Note to staff: Don't call two women "guys."

Haven't been here in literally ages, so its a new experience in my mind! Clean slate and all that . . .  We arrived shortly after opening and there were only a few people here - still, our party of three was seated right next to another party of three in the booths area to the right of the restaurant. Talk about density dining !  I almost requested another table but bit my tongue - next time I'll ask. The group next to us was as loud as we were, and when they moved my seat moved - grrrrr.  Not sure why the waitress thought this seating pattern was great, but it wasn't. A third party came a short while later - an elderly couple - and she was going to seat the on the other side of us !  About 10 booths, both sides of an aisle, and three in a row ?! Not tic-tac-toe here! How about some "space"? Anyway, the elderly gentleman asked for the booth across the aisle when he realized the intended location of his quiet meal. I hope I grow in his wisdom - but that was on me this time, as I thought but did not ask. Moving on . . .  The place itself is nicely decorated and designed - I liked it a lot. Nice colors, shapes and layout helped relax me - until the noise next door got to me again! Oh well. The waitress, Lauren, was very outstanding. She was attentive, patient and efficient. Food service was quick, and drinks were kept filled - to our delight. She even offered additional ice in a glass for our iced teas before I could ask (although I had thought it shortly before she came by . . . good intuition on her part). We had a small plate appetizer, the white corn guacamole chips. Different, but the white corn didn't add anything - tasted like guacamole! It was good guacamole, but again, why add the corn ? Chips were good and crunchy, but could've used a few more. We had salads for starters. One of us had a lunch special - available 11am to 4pm, you get choice of two items. He had a Mediterranean salad and we had a half-size Italian chopped and a small plate petite wedge salad (hold the bacon). They were fresh and delicious. The dressing for the wedge was house made blue and very nice. For main dishes we had the 7" mushroom pepperoni pizza (as the second choice for the lunch special), a regular size (full dinner plate sized) wild mushroom (Shaved cremini, shiitake, portobello and white mushrooms with slivered scallions, cracked black pepper, romano and mozzarella), with optional thin crust, and the Jambalaya fettuccine pasta. All were very good, and the mushroom was especially flavorful, but could have used more toppings - the mushrooms were that good! Not sure, though, why they charge extra to sub thin crust on these for the regular crust, although they have "thin crust" pizzas as well. We actually tried dessert, although we were already full. The key lime pie was sublime, and not overpowering, although I love key lime and would've preferred a bit more "tang." We also tried the salted caramel pudding, which was surprisingly better than we expected. The "oreo crumb crust" (what we thought it resembled, but is described as black cocoa cookie crumbs) and the pudding were a perfect pairing. Wow - could easily make that at home! The overall experience was very nice (excepting the initial seating goofiness), and the place got busier as lunch went on but never filled up or took away from the level of service. Would definitely recommend. It can be pricey, depending on what and how much you order, but compared to other places in Bay Area (and this one in Marin) it was not a cardiac jolt for us - $88 for all that stuff and three iced teas. Will be back !

Yes, it's a chain, and it's in a shopping center. So what? Besides pizza, this place has a good selection of salads, pastas, soups, appetizers, you name it. My favorite is their Cobb salad, to which you can add beets if you wish. Very good that way. They have a nice lunch combo option on weekdays too. This is a consistently good place for us. Funny, I think I've only had a pizza once at California Pizza Kitchen. Their salads are so great!

We've eaten at this CPK a lot this past year, mostly because it's a convenient dinner spot if you're dining with small children.  Unfortunately, today was such a disappointment in terms of service that it was probably our last visit, which is sad as we were pretty regular customers.  All in all, it was the worst service we've ever had.  Painful is a good word to describe it.  It was slow at every point - we had to track someone down to ask if we could order, we asked for bread repeatedly and were told it was "in the oven" even though we saw 3 other tables near us get bread while we waited (they had a different waitress), and we even had to track someone down to ask for the check.  I was so ready to give up and just leave after we ordered, as my one year old son had already colored as much as he could and was getting hungry.  I even walked with him outside to distract him, the wait was so long. While we were outside, the manager came over to my husband and told him that the delays were due to a waiter calling in sick last minute.  When she saw me walk up with my son, she then threw in that another waiter had called in because her one year old son had hit his head.  Hmm, interesting that the second story had to do with a child the same age as ours, exactly when I walked up with our son.  I would have believed her except that every table around us, even those that were seated right before as well as after us, seemed to get their food & drinks before we did.  The family that was seated literally minutes before us, but in a different section, were well into their meal by the time we ordered.  It was just ridiculous to the very end, when we waited and waited some more to even get the check.  I used to defend this place as a decent spot to eat if you have kids - lots of food choices, good salads, a kid's menu, etc., but today was so bad that I have no desire to ever go there again.

Delicious food, especially love their thin crust margherita pizza. Had my daughter's birthday party there, with 11 girls, and the management and waiters could not have been more helpful and gracious. Highly recommend this restaurant, especially the Corte Madera location.

Going in about 2:30 yesterday.  Server never offer refill or care to ask for the food quality. My daughter ordered mac and chess. It is super dry not looking good, at the end we found out that all of the chess were at the bottom of the plate. My Cobb Salad "Tasteless". Manager? never mind....no words

Thai Crunch Salad! This is one of my favorite salads that can be found at any CPK. I get it without chicken and substitute avocado instead. I also ask for extra dressing. This CPK is more casual than some others I have visited (such as Monterey and Honolulu), though still has the same food quality. The service is speedy, though not overly friendly. The space itself is casual and sometimes has the appearance of being messy (or less than clean). I come here as the location is great and food selection/quality can be counted on.

Service is horrible, my waiter flout out IGNORED me when I signaled her to come over. The food is really nothing special especially the pizza which they claim to have the best. Go somewhere else like the Cheesecake Factory which has a much nicer ambiance, food, and service.

I usually look forward to getting the jambalaya pasta from CPK, but was disappointed with this CPK location. It wasn't as good as I remembered. Pasta dishes are good, but just your ordinary Italian-American. Nothing amazing. Their shrimp zucchini pasta dish I ordered was mostly zucchini! Only a few strands of fettuccine. Idk if that's the way the dish was meant to be, but such a let down. The jambalaya pasta dish didn't have any cohesion. It tasted like the ingredients were just tossed together, the spices weren't cooked into the pasta and meat.

To start off they had no CO2 which meant they had no draft beer the server stated they hadn't had any for 3 days. Okay well we decided to order bottled beer. We waited and waited for the bottled beer took over 10min to get to our table. The dining room was fairly empty maybe had 4-5 tables in the entire restaurant. Food was good and came out fast. We grabbed our plates and they were dirty. No refills or water which we asked for walked up to the front bar/kitchen area to get water and another round of beers. Won't be back if we're in the area again.
I had Kelsey at the bar/counter and she was AMAZING! She's so sweet and lovely, I will definitely be coming back for more of her tasty Moscow Mule's. Definitely deserving of 5 stars.

Sadly this CPK is scheduled to close down in about a week or two due to their lease end and the owner is doubling the rent. Just wanna say thank you to this cpk for all the good dinning experience through out the past 10 plus years. This is a great place for family to hang out. Food quality is always great and consistent, service is always good. Feel really bad for all the employees here since they were just told about the closing a day before this review. Anyway wish you all the best and I sincerely hope CPK corporate will find another location in Marin to reopen.

CPK, usually satisfies me, but I have to give a low rating due to service. Our server didn't really check on us, forgot to give me hot sauce after asking 15 mins prior, would avoid eye contact when needing help, and kept another table waiting. Normally, this is fine when it is busy...but it wasn't. There were only 3-4 tables. Sadly, we were one of the two who weren't getting any service.

Thank you so much to terrific staff at CPK over past many years.  You folks are loved and wishing you all very well.  Landlord (Town Center) is doubling rent from $16K to $32K per month - forcing out CPK after something like 15+ years here.  Shame on Town Center for the aggressive price hike that forces out a family friendly place, celiac safe kitchen, and a landmark for many years.  The community hit to Corte Madera residents from family friendly restaurant closures continues.

My kids love this place...so we come here probably once / month. Everything is just fine for feeding a family...reasonably priced (especially if you buy gift cards from Costco), portions are fine AND they have a great kids menu. BUT...I just learned they are closing this location permanently on 1/22/17
